p: Since according to the Franck-Condon principle, the same oscillator behaves in the same elementary molecular act both as a quantum system (near the turning points of the nuclei) and as a classical system (near the bottom of the potential well for the nuclei), then the Franck-Condon principle is essentially one of the most important prerequisites for the creation of quantum-classical mechanics (see Sections 2.1 and 2.5), the simplest implementation of which is demonstrated in this article.
